Key Match Events: Luis Gil pitched six innings in his return from a back injury, allowing only one hit.
Aaron Judge hit an RBI double and scored on Austin Wells’ two-run single.
The Yankees achieved their first shutout since August 23 against the Colorado Rockies.
Luke Weaver handled the ninth inning for his first career save in 199 major-league appearances.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone commented, 'It was a good day.'
Craig Counsell reflected, 'I thought Gil threw the ball well, but we got to do a better job.'
Luis Gil expressed through an interpreter, 'The more innings that I pitched, felt better.'
Anthony Rizzo shared, 'It was just cool to be here. A lot of smiles.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anthony Rizzo received multiple standing ovations from the crowd at Wrigley Field.
